fields.description:
h3. Summary

When issue transition button is clicked during the page load it throws an error as shown in the screenshot below:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Jira issue view screen of an issue
 # Click on any transition button immediately once the button appeared on the screen
 ## !image-2018-05-22-20-59-43-119.png|width=473,height=169!
 ## !image-2018-05-22-21-02-31-523.png|width=415,height=215!

h3. Expected Results

The transition should not be allowed until the page is fully loaded and wait until the page is loaded completely.
h3. Actual Results

Throws an error while the button is clicked during the page load process is taking place

Workaround
 - Wait until the entire page is loaded
fields.summary: Transition button throwing error when clicked during the page load

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When editing an inactive workflow, you're able to add a new transition with a name already used in the workflow. You can then drag the arrows and change the origin and the destination statuses so you'll have two different transitions with the same name and same mapping.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit an inactive workflow in Diagram mode.
 # Let's say there is a transition from "To Do" to "In Progress" called "Start Progress". Add a new transition with the same "Start Progress" name from and to different statuses.
 # Now drag the arrows and put that new transition from the "To Do" to the "In Progress" statuses.

h3. Expected Results

Jira should throw an error message to prevent users from adding two transitions with the same name between the same statuses.
h3. Actual Results

You will be able to add the transitions normally.
 * !Edit_—_Copy_of_jira_-_Jira.png|thumbnail!
 * !Edit_Workflow_—_Copy_of_jira_-_Jira.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

The workaround is to delete the duplicated transition.
fields.summary: Duplicated transition when editing an inactive workflow

fields.description: It would be very helpful to be able to customize the Links or Tabs that are available to users in a JIRA Cloud instance. That would allow for users to be able to reference specific aspects of the instance with an easy-to-access link/tab.
fields.summary: Allow the Customization of Sidebar Links/Tabs

fields.description:
It is currently not possible to change the fields order when opening the issue detail view in a business board, the current order seems to be random.

Customers should be able to customize the fields order in a business board.
fields.summary: Business board - Configure issue detail view fields order.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently it's not possible to convert issues with standard issue type to sub-tasks from board ('Active Sprints' or 'Backlog'), when the 'New Jira issue view' is enabled.
The option for converting to sub-task is available when you directly access the issue page, or when 'New Jira issue view' is disabled.

h3. Suggested Solution
Please implement the ability to convert issues to sub-tasks in boards when 'New Jira issue view' is enable.
fields.summary: Ability to convert to sub-tasks from board in 'New Jira issue view'

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The incoming handler as of now, processes hyperlinks/email addresses that are not attached to a value and add them as string in tickets. This can lead to confusion and miscommunication.

Can potentially be dangerous as well if the context of the email is to grant application access to a single email but JIRA adds the other email into the ticket; leading to other users being able to access the instance as well.

h3. Investigation Done

An email might appear like this :
{quote}Hi team ,

Could you please do the needful for adding vchin@atlassian.com
{quote}
But at the source/raw HTML level it actually contains another hidden hyperlink/email :
{quote}Hi team ,

Could you please do the needful for adding *vchin@atlassian.com
 <vchin@atlassian.com>* * <vchin-1@atlassian.com>* to following
 email group.
{quote}
When JIRA processes the email, it will include the 2nd hidden email as well. It will appear as this in the JIRA ticket :
{quote}Hi team ,

Could you please do the needful for adding vchin@atlassian.com vchin-1@atlassian.com
{quote}

This can be done by hyperlinking empty spaces (space bar and then highlight the spaces) with a URL in an email client.

h3.Expected Behavior

The incoming mail handler should ignore URLs/email addresses that are not linked to a valid value.


h3.Current Behavior

The incoming mail handler processes URLs/email addresses that are not linked to a valid value.
fields.summary: Incoming mail handler should not process hyperlinks/email addresses that are not attached to a value

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Processing an email (with attachment), mail handler creates the issue, and fails to upload the attachment as it receives exception from Media API.
Following error appears in logs:
{noformat}
Got error while saving attachment <attachment>: Got exception while saving attachment in attachment store. Exception: com.atlassian.jira.issue.attachment.store.media.MediaApiStreamAttachmentStore$FailureMediaApiResponseException: [AttachmentUploadFailure] Could not upload attachment
    	 stack:	 java.io.IOException: Got error while saving attachment <attachment>: Got exception while saving attachment in attachment store. Exception: com.atlassian.jira.issue.attachment.store.media.MediaApiStreamAttachmentStore$FailureMediaApiResponseException: [AttachmentUploadFailure] Could not upload attachment
Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.web.util.AttachmentException: Got error while saving attachment <attachment>: Got exception while saving attachment in attachment store. Exception: com.atlassian.jira.issue.attachment.store.media.MediaApiStreamAttachmentStore$FailureMediaApiResponseException: [AttachmentUploadFailure] Could not upload attachment
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: com.atlassian.jira.issue.attachment.store.media.MediaApiStreamAttachmentStore$FailureMediaApiResponseException: [AttachmentUploadFailure] Could not upload attachment
Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.issue.attachment.store.media.MediaApiStreamAttachmentStore$FailureMediaApiResponseException: [AttachmentUploadFailure] Could not upload attachment
Caused by: org.apache.http.NoHttpResponseException: api-internal.media.atlassian.com:443 failed to respond
{noformat}
h3. Note

This issue occurs intermittently.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a mail server.
 # Add a mail handler and associate it to the mail server in step 1.
 # Send an email with attachment to the email address defined in mail server (step 1).

h3. Expected Results

Mail handler creates issue from email and attaches the email's attachments to the issue.
h3. Actual Results

Mail handler creates issue from email, and fails to upload the attachment. Following comment is added to the issue as anonymous:
{code:java}
An error occurred while adding attachments to this issue from the source email. Please check the attachments and re-send the email.
{code}
fields.summary: Mail handler intermittently fails to upload attachment from email and adds comment as anonymous

fields.description:
The current steps to not invite users to Bitbucket are as follows
 
- So we can disable it by going to DVCS accounts
 1. Click on the ellipses(..) on the Bitbucket account
 2. Click on Configure automatic access
 3. Make sure to unchecked the groups 
 4. Do this for all the Bitbucket accounts that are linked to DVCS accounts page
 - However, if the user clicks on the Site administration dropdown, they can still see Bitbucket accounts listed there. However, they won't be able to access the repositories
 - If all is unchecked, then the message
{code:java}
”All new users will be invited to Bitbucket”
{code}
will not be shown on invite user page
  

These steps are not very intuitive to an end user and require them contacting support to figure it out.
fields.summary: please simplify the steps to uninvite bitbucket users.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
"Create room" for Stride doesn't work.

 !Screenshot 2018-05-21 11.48.55.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
Verified with several supported browsers:

* Chrome Version 66.0.3359.139 (Official Build) (64-bit)
* Firefox 60.0.1 (64-bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Associate a Stride instance with Jira Cloud
# Go to an arbitrary issue
# Select "Create room" in Stride room
# Check "Create" button doesn't work

h3. Expected Results

The room is created.

h3. Actual Results
Unable to create the room. Besides, browser console complains the error:
{noformat}
DedicatedRoomsConfig.js:139 GET https://banana-addon-jira.us-west-2.prod.public.atl-paas.net/banana/issuewatchers?url=https%3A%2F%2F__YOUR_SUBDOMAIN__.atlassian.net%2Fbrowse%2FSP-8 404 ()
DedicatedRoomsConfig.js:122 POST https://banana-addon-jira.us-west-2.prod.public.atl-paas.net/banana/room 500 ()
{noformat}


h3.Workaround
None.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you're in the settings of the instance and click to create an issue, then the create issue screen goes to another page, instead of the pop-up screen. 
After you select the Project and the Issue Type, and click on Next. The avatar of the issue type is not displayed, and the issue type name is displayed twice.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a settings screen like Custom Field, for example.
 # Click on Create Issue Button.
 # Select a Project and Issue Type and click on Next.

h3. Expected Results

The avatar of the Issue Type is displayed properly and the Issue Type Name is displayed just once.
h3. Actual Results

The avatar of the Issue Type is not displayed and the Issue Type Name is displayed twice:
 !Screen Shot 2018-05-18 at 17.07.07.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

If you click on the create issue button from your home screen, where it goes to a pop-up screen, the avatar and the name of the Issue Type is displayed just fine.
fields.summary: Issue Type Name is showing twice in the Create Issue Screen.

fields.description: It would be beneficial if a possibility to customize the color of buttons and other UI elements is implemented. For instance, there's no way to change the color of the "Comment Internally" button. It can lead to mistakes as the button is hard for some to distinguish from the "Share with Customer" one.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I would like to have more options of color customisation

fields.description:
h2. Problem Description

Running a Jira Import on a Jira Cloud instance hits into error:
{noformat}
jira-import timed out: HEARTBEAT
{noformat}

h2. Steps to Replicate 

# Process import file (/) No errors
# Redirected to Jira Import Wizard, make selection and click proceed (/) No errors
# Jira Import progress showing starting task, stuck on 0% for 5 minutes and error message (x) Waited for 5 minutes and error pops up
{noformat}
["jira-import timed out: HEARTBEAT"]
{noformat}

h2. Workaround

Currently there is no workaround to this issue, we are still actively working to resolve this. Please watch this bug ticket to get an update when it is available.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud Import Failed with jira-import timeout HEARTBEAT

fields.description: I have an account used be a group of people, used to open issues in our jira environment, but they reset the password. I'd like to be able to disable it for just that one user.
fields.summary: Disable the ability to request a password reset for one particular user.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When there are Agility projects in the Jira Cloud instance, it shouldn't be possible to generate backup for Server, since the Agility project is a Cloud only feature. However, it's still possible to generate a backup for Server with Agility Projects and once this backup is imported on Server, it breaks the whole instance.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Agility project in the Cloud instance
# Try to generate a backup for Server

h3. Expected Results
The backup for Server option shouldn't be available and show the following message:
{quote}
Your site contains independent projects. Jira Software Server and Data Center don't support these. If you want to create a server backup, contact support.
{quote}

h3. Actual Results
The backup for Server option is still available and once imported on Server, it causes 500 error.
 
h3.Workaround
Remove the Agility Projects from the Cloud instance and generate a new backup for Server
fields.summary: Backup for Server option still available when there are Agility Projects on the instance

fields.description:
h3. Summary
No matter the configuration set on Look and Feel for Date format, it will always been displayed as yyyy/MMM/dd on the new issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Look and Feel Date format
# Edit the Date format to something different from yyyy/MMM/dd, as example, set to dd/MMM/yyyy
# Go back to issue creation page
# Create an issue and set the Due Date
# Go to the board and click on the card
# The new issue view will open, check the Due Date format, it will be displayed as yyyy/MMM/dd
# If open the issue directly, the Due Date format will be displayed exactly as is configured on Look and Feel

Check the video below where it the difference on Due Date format.

h3. Expected Results
Due date should be reflecting the same format as configured on Look and Feel

h3. Actual Results
No matter the configuration set on Look and Feel for Date format, it will always been displayed as yyyy/MMM/dd on the new issue view

h3.Workaround
Access the Personal Settings (https://<INSTANCENAME>.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa) and de-activate the new issue view and add the due date to be displayed directly on card layout.
fields.summary: Date format set on look and feel is not reflecting on the new issue view on the board

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Remaining time doesn't reflect the change of estimated time
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Open the issue detail view and enter an initial value(ex. 1d) for the "Time estimate" field
 * Click it again and enter a new value(ex. 1w)
 * See the issue detail view

h3. Expected Results

Remaining time will be set as 1w
h3. Actual Results

Remaining time keeps the original value
 !スクリーンショット 2018-05-17 11.42.04.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

This doesn't depend on the sprint status or the due date
h3. Workaround
# Open the issue full-page view by clicking the issue key
# Click the + icon next to the Time Tracking field and set as the following:
 * Time Spent: 1m(the minimum value)
 * Remaining Estimate: Set to 1w
fields.summary: Remaining time doesn't reflect the change of estimated time

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Whenever importing from Trello, even archived lists are being imported as statuses.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option to not import archived lists.

h3. Why this is important
Depending on the number of archived lists, it can result in *a lot* of undesired statuses being created.

h3. Workaround 
Manually change workflow
fields.summary: Trello importer needs an option for not importing archived lists

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Create an additional global permission related only to the *Public* sharing of dashboards, filters or any other content.

h3. Reason
Sometimes users will make content and share it with the *Public* option, not being completely aware that they are sharing with anyone without an account on the Cloud site itself.
fields.summary: Break the "Share dashboards and filters" into an additional global permission to restrict "Public" sharing

fields.description: It would be great to have the option to export a list of all existing projects in JIRA, including basic project information, such as project lead, number of issues, associated schemes, letting the user choose with information he would like to export.
fields.summary: Ability to export list of projects in JIRA.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently if there are more than 5 active users in user management, the following feature "Invite new users" won't be visible in User Management page:
 !User Management - Invite new users.png|thumbnail! 
Hence, admin no longer is able to set "Full Name" when adding new users.

h3. Suggested Resolution
Enable the feature "Invite new users" even if there are more than 5 active users in user management. Or, grant the admin ability to set "Full Name" when adding new users.
fields.summary: Ability to set "Full Name" when adding new users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

There are times that user want to get the list of users who are actively using certain add-ons for audit or any other purposes. Jira doesn't currently have such feature and it would be great to have.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide feature to find which users using certain add-ons
fields.summary: Feature to find which users using certain add-ons

fields.description: Allow users to change the position of the error message when a required field is not filled in during a transition screen. Another option would be allow users to choose between an error message on the screen or a popup containing the error message.
fields.summary: Allow customization of the position of the error message when a required field is not filled in

fields.description: I would like to choose how the prefix of the email of new users will be created, once I'm importing issues via the CSV Importer
fields.summary: Choose How to Create the User's Email on CSV Import

fields.description: There are some cases where that field might not be relevant and we have no option to make that field not a mandatory one.
fields.summary: As a project manager, I want to be able to set 'Summary' as a not required field.

fields.description: Some customers would like to have the option to export attachment files with their original name, instead of an automatically generated number, so these attachments would be easier to locate and manage.
fields.summary: Export Attachments with their original name

fields.description:
The existing documentation we have on how non-admins can request add-ons is no longer accurate for Jira cloud.  
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/requesting-add-ons-765593643.html
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/requesting-add-ons-939938973.html
https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/requesting-add-ons-780868055.html

I am not sure when this change happened in Cloud, but Cloud site admins no longer have the option to turn on requests to see what add-ons their users want to see.  As such all of these documentation guides no longer apply to the current Cloud state.

The Jira Server versions of these documents should stay, as these features are still possible in Server.
fields.summary: Requesting add-ons documentation is no longer valid for Jira Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Duplicate tickets are created when the *CC Watchers* checkbox is selected in the email handler configuration and an incoming email with an email address address that belongs to JSD portal-only customers that have user_key longer than 60 characters.

What happens is the following:
* JIRA starts processing the email and creates a new issue from it
* The email handler tries to add the email addresses in CC to the issue watchers
* One (or more) of the email addresses in CC have user_key longer than 60 characters
* Adding the watcher fails, the email is not set as processed and at the next run the handler will try to process it again starting back from step #1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have incoming mail handler set to automatically add each user in CC as a watcher (by selecting the *CC Watchers* checkbox)
# Send an email which has in Cc a JSD portal-only customer email address (with an username randomly generated of 60+ characters) 
The bug can't be reproduced with "normal" users with usernames more than 60 characters as these accounts have still user_key less than 60 char. They are still managed and added as watchers without issues, the JSD portal-only customer updated to randomly generated usernames have their user_key longer than 60 char.


h3. Expected Result
One ticket is created from the incoming email

h3. Actual Result
Jira keeps creating new tickets from the same email.

The below Stack trace is found in the logs:

{noformat}
2018-04-06 16:02:50.252	
ERROR	
APITeam[10100]: Exception: Caught PSQLException for insert into "public"."userassociation" ("association_type", "source_name", "sink_node_entity", "sink_node_id") values (?, ?, ?, ?)
Caught PSQLException for insert into "public"."userassociation" ("association_type", "source_name", "sink_node_entity", "sink_node_id") values (?, ?, ?, ?)

Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: value too long for type character varying(60) at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.receiveErrorResponse(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2477) at 
org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.processResults(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2190) at 
org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.execute(QueryExecutorImpl.java:300) at
 org.postgresql.jdbc.PgStatement.executeInternal(PgStatement.java:428) at 
org.postgresql.jdbc.PgStatement.execute(PgStatement.java:354) at 
org.postgresql.jdbc.PgPreparedStatement.executeWithFlags(PgPreparedStatement.java:169) at 
org.postgresql.jdbc.PgPreparedStatement.executeUpdate(PgPreparedStatement.java:136) at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor422.invoke(Unknown 
Source) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498) at 
org.vibur.dbcp.proxy.AbstractInvocationHandler.targetInvoke(AbstractInvocationHandler.java:145) at 
org.vibur.dbcp.proxy.StatementInvocationHandler.doProcessExecute(StatementInvocationHandler.java:204) at 
org.vibur.dbcp.proxy.StatementInvocationHandler.on(StatementInvocationHandler.java:195) at 
com.atlassian.jira.connpool.JiraViburConnectionPoolProvider.lambda$null$5(JiraViburConnectionPoolProvider.java:145) at 
org.vibur.dbcp.proxy.StatementInvocationHandler.processExecute(StatementInvocationHandler.java:137) at 
org.vibur.dbcp.proxy.StatementInvocationHandler.restrictedInvoke(StatementInvocationHandler.java:91) at 
org.vibur.dbcp.proxy.StatementInvocationHandler.restrictedInvoke(StatementInvocationHandler.java:41) at 
org.vibur.dbcp.proxy.AbstractInvocationHandler.invoke(AbstractInvocationHandler.java:81) at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy4994.executeUpdate(Unknown Source) at 
com.querydsl.sql.dml.AbstractSQLInsertClause.execute(AbstractSQLInsertClause.java:414) ... 39 more
{noformat}



h3. Workaround

De-select the *CC Watchers* check box in the email handler configuration

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the New Issue view, when one wants to adjust the Start date and time, the only time interval available is between 9am and 6pm

h3. Environment
* Jira Software Cloud
* New Issue View

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In the Sprint view screen of a Scrum Project, click one of the issues and notice the New Issue view (pop-up screen).
# Attempt to log time by clicking the + sign next to Time Tracking. 
This should only work if the issue already has some time logged.
# Attempt to edit the Date started by clicking the calendar sign next to it
Notice the time picker only shows the 9am - 6pm time interval

# Expected Results
The time picker should show a whole day time interval

h3. Actual Results
The time picker only shows 9am - 6pm, in 30 minutes increments

h3. Workaround
There are currently 2 workarounds:
# Disable New Jira issue view under *Profile → Labs* section. This will bring the old issue view with another date/time picker
# Edit the Date started field in Issue Detail View. 
## Click on the *issue key* on top of the New Issue view
## Log work on Issue Detail View
fields.summary: Time picker in new issue view only shows hours from 9:00am to 6:00pm

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you create two custom fields with the same name but with different letter cases the JIRA search will only recognize one of them unless you use cf[id] for searching.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two fields: "Test Field" (text type) and "Test field" (select list (multiple choices) type)
# Add them to the screens of a project and add values to them in some issues
# Try to search with the following JQL:
{noformat}
"Test Field" ~ "test"
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

The JIRA search should recognize this is related to the text field.

h3. Actual Results

The search throws the following error:
{noformat}
The operator '~' is not supported by the 'Test Field' field.
{noformat}

Searches for the options inside the "Test field" won't work as well.

h3.Notes

Another case here is both the custom fields are select lists. In such a case, the JQL will not recognize the options for both the lowercase and uppercase custom field. 

h3.Workaround

Use the direct reference for the custom field when searching, for example, cf[10290].
fields.summary: Having two custom fields with the same name but different letter cases causes problems at the JIRA search

fields.description:
{panel:title=July 30, 2020: The ability to enable/disable keyboard shortcuts is now available to 100% of Jira Cloud customers.}
Hi everyone,

Thank you all for your comments & feedback on this. My name's Matt and I'm one of the product managers in Jira Cloud. My team picked this problem up and have just started to roll out a feature that will allow users to enable/disable shortcuts at a per-user level.

See the attached screenshot of what this will look like. We were constrained by time so we decided to put it into the keyboard shortcuts dialog for now. You can access the keyboard shortcuts dialog from:
 # The Help (?) menu (in the top right of the navigation) and clicking 'Keyboard shortcuts'
 # Or by using the existing shortcut to bring up the keyboard shortcuts dialog (Shift + ?). _Note: If you disable the shortcuts, you won't be able to reopen the dialog via Shift + ?_

We believe this will address the problem and in the future, we will consider adding it inside the user profile page. 

Kind regards,

Matt
{panel}
h3. Summary

According to the following documentation page, to enable or disable keyboard shortcuts a user would need to access their profiles and under the *User preferences* section, select the pen icon  !https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/files/945101533/945101534/1/1502080666884/Screen+Shot+2017-07-10+at+11.44.54+AM.png|width=19,height=20!
 * [Managing your user profile|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/managing-your-user-profile-765593632.html]

However, when accessing the profile, the option isn't available anymore.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to your Jira Cloud site, click on your avatar (bottom left corner) and click on *Profile*
 # In the *Preferences* section, click *Edit* (the pencil icon)

h3. Expected Results

An option to enable or disable keyboard shortcuts should be available.
h3. Actual Results

There's no such option available in the profile settings anymore.

!user preferences.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: The option to enable or disable keyboard shortcuts isn't available anymore under the profile options

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * As a Jira user I want to export my issues to csv to use as reports for monitoring or for use in some meetings.
 * I don't need to include all the comments but I want to include specifically the "last comment" in my report.

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Provide the option to export comments through the built-in exporter.
 * include the feature to select specifically "Last comment" similarly to this third part app [[https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/15064/ccc-last-comment?hosting=server&tab=overview]].

h3. Why this is important
 * This gives a better overview of the issue and the progress of work when the exporter is used to generate reports.

h3. Workaround
 * Add the last comment as an update to the description field before the export as shown in this video [[^Recording #152.mp4]].
fields.summary: Export last comment to CSV or Excel

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When issues have a summary containing a space before a hyphen the JQL search does not find them.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue with the summary {{AB - AB}}
# Try to search for the issue with the following JQL:
{noformat}
summary ~ "AB - AB"
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

The JQL search finds the created issue.

h3. Actual Results

The search gives no error but no issues are returned.

h3.Workaround

Use JQLs without putting the space before the hyphen:
{noformat}
summary ~ "AB- AB"
{noformat}
fields.summary: Searching for texts with a space before a hyphen does not work

h3. Workaround

2. Build a string of the form username:api_token.

{quote}

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Deleting attachments from board's issue detail view does not delete attachments from the issue

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to a board
# Single click on an issue card
# Scroll down to comment area and click *Add a comment...*
# Attach a file to the comment and click *Save*. The attachment is now saved to the Comment
# Click the issue number link at the top of the screen. You will see the file you attached to the Comment in the Attachments area
# Go back to the related board
# Click on the card you added the comment to, scroll to the comment and delete the attached file.
# Click the issue number link at the top of the screen.  

h3. Expected Results
The file attached is not visible in the issue view

h3. Actual Results
You' will see the deleted file still attached to the issue

 !Screen Shot 2018-05-11 at 4.15.36 PM.png|thumbnail! 

 !Screen Shot 2018-05-11 at 4.15.55 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes


h3.Workaround

Disable the new issue detail view Lab Feature. To do this, please follow the steps described below:

# Click on your avatar, at the bottom-left of the screen then click *Profile*
# Under *Labs*, disable *Issue detail view* moving the button to the left (the gray icon means "disabled").

PS: ask your users to do it, the steps above works only for the current user.
fields.summary: Deleting attachments from board's issue detail view does not delete attachments from the issue

*Summary*
A pop-up error message saying "Issue does not exist or you do not have permission" appears to customers in different places in Jira

*Environment*

*Steps to Reproduce*
This is an intermittent error but, so far, it happens when:
# attaching a file to an issue
# looking at an issue open for a few minutes
# looking at a board open for some time
# logging work on an issue

*Expected Results*
No pop-up error appearing if there is no error

*Actual Results*
Even if you attach a file successfully, or have permission to see issues or boards, the pop-up appears.

*Workaround*
fields.summary: Pop-up error message "Issue does not exist or you do not have permission"

fields.description:
*Problem*
When a Business project has multiple workflows, the Board is not usable.

*Suggestion*
Add the ability to remove the "Board" from business projects with multiple workflows.
fields.summary: Remove "Board" menu from business projects with multiple workflows

fields.description:
*Summary*

When uploading the attachment with a "^" symbol in the title, the attachment gets uploaded into the "Attachments" section of the issue view but if you try to include it within the comments, you will get an error " Unable to render embedded object: File not found. " 

 

 

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Create an attachment with title containing "^" symbol, for example (test^test.png)
 # Upload or drag and drop the attachment in the issue view page
 # The attachment will be shown in the *Attachments* section of the issue view 
 # In the comment section itself the attachment will not render and show you an error. 

 

 

*Expected Results*

To be able to attach an image containing the special character "^"  

*Actual Results*

Not able to attach an image containing the special character "^"  

 
*Workaround*
Remove the "^" symbol from the title of the image and reupload it again to the issue page, the picture will show properly in the comment section.
fields.summary: Attachment containing special character ^ in the title will not render

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, the only possible way to move tickets from one JIRA instance to another is by using the CSV export/import method. This is a great method when there's a need to transfer tickets in bulk, but when moving a single issue, having a button in the issue view would be better. As a user, I'd like to have this button available which would make this process easier.

h3. Suggested Solution
A button could be available in the issue view, which would allow the user to move a ticket to another instance.

h3. Why this is important

Currently, we are seeing cases in the support channel where customers work in more than one instance (third-party vendors, partners, their own customers, etc). They have access to those instances, having a licensed user account registered on them. This feature is a good way to increase the collaboration between different teams, in different Cloud instances.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to have a button available in the issue view that would allow me to a transfer ticket to another Cloud instance easily

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While viewing an issue with the custom filter for a project. If an issue link to another project is provided in the issue and you click it, it takes you to the linked issue. The problem is when you click back from the linked issue, the URL changes to the original issue but the page stays on the linked issue

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a linked issue in Project A (A-1) to an issue in Project B (B1)
 # View a custom filter. The URL should look something like example: https://<instance>.atlassian.net/projects/A/queues/custom/100
 # Find the issue in A-1 that you created issue link in and click it.
 # Click the created issue link B-1 which should be present on A-1
 # You should now be viewing the issue link B-1
 # Click the browser back button

h3. Expected Result
The issue view should go back and show the issue A-1

h3. Actual results
The URL changes to issue A-1 but the page remain on issue B-1. Like the page failed to refresh.

h3. Workaround
Refresh the browser each time.
fields.summary: Back button remains on the wrong issue view when clicked

fields.description: The Copy board feature copies the board with all its settings.   It would be nice if there was a feature to only copy the column mappings of the board, and not the filters/shared configuration and projects.
fields.summary: Ability to copy a board that only contains the same column mappings

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Enabling Jira Mobile Connect in project settings of Jira Cloud should not prompt admin to reindex
 In the current state of Jira Cloud, there are no indexes. However for the JMC, when you enable this in a project, it prompts you to reindex. This should be removed in Jira Cloud because asking an admin to do something impossible is a frustrating and bad end user experience.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As a Jira site admin, open a project settings page
 # Navigate to Summary
 # Scroll down to Settings
 # Enable JIRA Mobile Connect for this project

h3. Actual Results

User is prompted to:
{quote}Custom fields have been updated. Please perform a re-index.
{quote}
However trying to click that link today, sends to your a 500 error page as it is not possible for Admins to reindex in cloud anymore

!customfieldindex.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

User should not see a message telling them to reindex in Cloud.
h3. Workaround

none
fields.summary: Enabling Jira Mobile Connect in project settings of Jira Cloud should not prompt admin to reindex

fields.description:
When user tries to add new transition to the workflow, the message below is being displayed:

"You cannot perform this operation on a draft workflow".
fields.summary: "You cannot perform this operation on a draft workflow"

fields.description:
Nowadays, you can change the number from 50 issues in a page, but you can only due this globally.
I would like to have the option to choose my own number of issues, per user.
fields.summary: Change Number of Issues Per Page Individually

fields.description:
h4. Problem Definition

It is already possible to add pictures only as normal attachments, many customers want to be able to add a picture to the comments.

h4. Suggested Solution

Allow mobile users to add pictures to the comments section and also add annotations to the image.

h4. Why this is important

Enhance the user and admin experience.
fields.summary: Jira mobile - Ability to add picture as a comment

fields.description:
When using mentions in large organizations, or in organizations with distinct groups or sub-organizations, it can be very difficult to tell which specific user you have mentioned in an issue.

In order to assist users in selecting the correct user the first time, we would like to see more of the user information provided in the autocomplete.

We would like to suggest populating the "Job title" from the Atlassian Account can be populated, that would work to empower users to improve the specificity of the mentions and would make it far easier to distinguish between users with similar names and emails.
fields.summary: Provide more Information in mention autocomplete

fields.description: I've seen several tickets on this and none of them help me.  Please explain how I can JQL for inactive users.  Like someone left the company and now we need to manage their ticket work and there is no way to get the list efficiently.  Am I just totally missing the information or is this not possible.
fields.summary: Ability to Query Inactive Users

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The System Dashboard appears twice in the Dashboards section if you set it as favorite.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to *Dashboards* and set the System dashboard as favorite.

h3. Expected Results
 * The System Dashboard should appear in the list as any other dashboard marked as favorite.

h3. Actual Results
 * The System Dashboard appears twice:
 !system-dashboard-fav.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
 * In the new Jira UI, the System Dashboard is listed even if you don't set as a favorite:
 !system-dashboard-not-fav.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: In the new Jira UI, the System Dashboard appears twice if you set it as favorite

fields.description:
when creating an issue it would be really nice if you could build in dynamic content into the title.

For example, when you're creating an issue in the backlog, or a subtask, you have to type the name and then go into the issue after and select assignee and other things.

Let's say for example the name of the issue is 'Create Sign Up Form', you could write:

'Create Sign Up Form \{username:leigh,component:sign up form,storypoints:3}'

Jira would automatically escape these from the title and use it to assign these details to the issue.

Would be nice if:
 * when you first type '\{' it would supply a list of options to choose from that filtered when you type AND automatically put the closing bracket '}'
 * when you first type ':' it would supply a list of options where appropriate i.e. usernames
 * and again after each ',' it would supply a new list of options
fields.summary: Creating Issues

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

The Portuguese indexing language will translate some resolutions automatically, but not others:
 !Screen Shot 2018-05-10 at 09.47.50.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the indexing language to Portuguese;
 # Go to a workflow (fluxo de trabalho) -> select a transition (transição) -> Add a post function (Adicionar uma post function);
 # Select update a custom field (Atualizar campo da ocorrência) -> select resolution (Resolução) -> check the values displayed as an option.

h3. Expected Results
All the resolutions should be translated.

h3. Actual Results
Some of the resolutions are translated, some are not.

h3. Workaround
No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Some resolutions are not translated in the Portuguese indexing language

fields.description:
The Android app is not supporting adding a comment in a transition screen.

https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Comment-field-missing-from-quot-resolve-issue-quot-screen-on/qaq-p/792958?utm_campaign=subscription_search_question&utm_content=topic&utm_medium=email&utm_source=atlcomm
fields.summary: Jira Mobile Android App does not support adding a comment in a transition screen

Problem
'Complete Sprint' shows a generic error saying that issues can't be edited because of its workflow status.

The error should mention what issues have a problem in their workflow.
fields.summary: 'Complete Sprint' shows a generic error saying that issues can't be edited because of its workflow status

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you disable New issue view Labs feature, the pop-up window does not have a "comment" field


h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Click on your avatar, at the bottom-left of the screen then click *Profile*
# Under *Labs*, disable *Issue detail view* moving the button to the left (the gray icon means "disabled").


h3. Expected Results
A "Give Feedback" pop-up window appears, allowing users to give feedback about the feature

h3. Actual Results
A "Give Feedback" pop-up window appears, showing only the fields *Name* and *Email*

 !Screen Shot 2018-05-09 at 8.39.26 PM.png|thumbnail! 



h3. Notes


h3.Workaround

Click the link *Close* in the pop-up window and click on your avatar, at the bottom-left of the screen and then click *Give feedback*
fields.summary: When you disable New issue view Labs feature, the pop-up window does not have a "comment" field

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the New issue view inline editor in Jira to write code, it changes any text which has two underscore between the word to italics after it has been saved.
h3. Environment

Jira Software Cloud instances, where the user profile has enabled the Jira Labs feature: Issue Detail view. This causes the issue once using the inline code WYSIWYG on the Description field displays any text that has two underscores in between the text after saving it turns that text to italics font instead of monospaced font.
h3. Create an issue

Under the Description field
 Add an inline code with the WYSIWYG
 Insert a text with two underscore on both sides of the text
 e.g: __sometext__
 Save the issue
!https://getsupport.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/2848129/Image%20036.png!
 
h3. Expected Results

Text saved should display with monospaced fonts
h3. Actual Results

While using the inline code on the new Jira issue view, Text with two underscores on both side of the text changes with italics font rather than monospaced font. Further checking under the Issue shows it doesn't use the \{code} macros and uses double curly brackets instead: \{{ }}
h3. Workaround

Disable the new issue view. For that follow the steps below:
 # Select your avatar and choose Profile
 # Turn off the New Jira issue view toggle under Labs
 https://<instance-name>.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa
 # Access the issue by clicking on the issue name at the top of the new issue view card.
fields.summary: Underscore on inline code makes the text italic in new Jira issue view
Unable to select filter from Advanced Search when adding gadget.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using heading styles, the preview is showing different sizes when compared to the actual results observed in the issue view. Although, the behavior is consistent when seeing an issue from the board issue view.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Create a comment on a JIRA issue containing the following headings: 

{code}
h1. Header 1

h2. Header 2

h3. Header 3

h4. Header 4

h5. Header 5

h6. Header 6
{code}

* Click on the preview button:

 !preview.png|thumbnail! 

* Compare the results with the issue view {{https://yourinstance.atlassian.net/browse/IssueID-#}}
* Compare the results in the board issue view {{https://yourinstance.atlassian.net/projects/ProjectKey/board?issue-key=IssueID-#}}

h3. Expected Results
The headings should match the results displayed in the preview.

h3. Actual Results
The headings are showing different sizes and spaces in the issue view when compared with the results displayed in the preview: 

*Preview*
!preview.png|thumbnail! 

*Issue view*
 !result - issue view.png|thumbnail! 

*Board view*
 !result - board view.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When seeing the Heading Styles in the text preview, they are different when compared to the actual results in the issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using Safari browser, when adding *Log time* in new Jira issue view (active sprint page), it's not possible to change the field *Date started*. If you select a date for *Date started*, the 'Log time' popup window will be closed automatically.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Software Cloud
* Mac OS
* Replicated using Safari (11.0.1)
 !Safari Browser - Version.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure *New Jira issue view* is enabled in profile.
# Go to *Active sprints* page in a Scrum board.
# Click on a card/ticket. The 'new Jira issue view' popup window appears.
# From menu (...) choose *Log time*. Log time popup window appears.
# Click on *Date started* field and choose a date.

h3. Expected Results
The selected date be set as *Date started*.

h3. Actual Results
The 'Log time' popup window will be closed automatically.

h3.Workaround
* Use different browser (Firefox, Chrome).
* Browse the issue page directly and add log work.
fields.summary: Unable to select 'Date started' when add 'Log time' in new Jira issue view using Safari browser

fields.description: The popup calendars for releases  (date picker field) had the week number at the start of each week, but this was recently removed. As week number can be used in releases or sprints, to have that week number visible on the calendar would be handy.
fields.summary: As a Jira user, I want to see the week number in the date picker on Jira date fields again

fields.description: It would be helpful to have multiple comments threaded into Jira Notifications, which would add additional clarity and context when users are responding through email
fields.summary: Comment Thread in Email Notifications

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When editing a worklog, the timezone displayed is not following the user's profile preference.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change the profile timezone to any timezone other than the Jira's default.
# Add or edit a worklog.
# The history/workflow of the issue will show the timezone based on the user's profile.
#*  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# But the edit/adding worklog is not reflecting the timezone in the user's profile.
#*  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* Adding/editing worklog screen should also display the time based on the user's profile.

h3. Actual Results
* Adding/editing worklog screen is displaying timezone based on the Jira's default timezone(General configuration)

h3. Workaround
* Change the user's profile preference to *Jira default* timezone.
fields.summary: Editing worklog is not following the timezone for profile's preference

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When a *Swimlane* is based on *Stories* or *Epics* the sub-tasks should also display the Epic Link field as their parents issue does. Subtasks should inherit its parent Epic Link .
h3. Suggested Solutions

Add the same behavior as Stories and Tasks for sub-tasks. 
 For example:
 When the swimlane is based on Epics:
 !epicbased.png|thumbnail!

When the swimlane is based on Stories:
 !storiesbased.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When a Swimlane is based on Stories or Epics the sub-tasks should also display the Epic Link field as their parents issue does.

fields.description: Currently there is an add on to enable integration with the Xstudio application that is available only for hosted instance. We need this for the cloud instance as well.
fields.summary: Create the Xstudio JIRA Integration Add On for Cloud

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

When reordering the priorities (by clicking on the arrow button) in the Priority section, it will reload the sidebar and switch it to the home's default.

Check the recording:  [^Sidebar change.mp4] 

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Jira home -> *Settings* -> *Issues* -> *Priorities*;
 # Click on the arrow button next to nay priority to reorder it in the hierarchy.

h3. Expected Results
There should not be any change other than the priority's reordering.

h3. Actual Results
The navigation sidebar will change to the home's path.

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Reordering the priorities will cause the sidebar to reload and switch to the Jira home's default

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Notifications that are sent from Jira are not delivered.

Steps to Reproduce
 # Update Jira issue, make sure that email notification about the change should be sent

h3. Expected Results

Email notifications should be delivered
h3. Actual Results

Email notification is not delivered
h3. Workaround

We are working on the fix having highest priority at the moment and will keep you posted.
Meanwhile, you can also subscribe to our updates, [here|https://status.atlassian.com/incidents/nmb3hp209m9l].

fields.description: The tooltip link to the JIRA Cloud documentation [Defining Priority Field Values|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-statuses-resolutions-and-priorities-776636333.html] is currently linking to a broken page, due to the renaming of the documentation.
fields.summary: Tooltip to Documentation for Priorities Broken

fields.description:
*Summary*

Sometimes while using your Jira Cloud instance you may notice an additional default mail server jira@xxxxxx.atlassian.net.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
-

h3. Expected Results
 * Have only one mail server

h3. Actual Results
 * Two equal mail servers are showing up.

h3. Notes

This is just an aesthetical issue, there is no problem in having two default mail server appearing, only one will be working.
fields.summary: Sometimes we can see two incoming default mail servers

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While attaching screenshot using the "CTRL + V" shortcut, JIRA throws the "The issue no longer exists." error.

Steps to reproduce the error:
 # Go to issue navigator.
 # Click on any filter. Eg: "Viewed recently"
 # Ensure that issue is shown in "Detail view".
 # Click on any issue. Ensure that the comment box is set to text mode.
 # Take any screenshot and use the "CTRL + V" shortcut in the comment box. The screenshot will be added. Cancel the action and click outside the comment box.
 # Try to use "CTRL + V" shortcut in the comment box again to attach the screenshot.
 # "The issue no longer exists." error will be shown.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Expected Results

Attachment attached without any error.
h3. Actual Results

Attachment not added and JIRA throws the "The issue no longer exists." error.
h3. Workaround
 # Attach the attachment by opening the new in individual issue page view.
 # Refresh the page and attach the screenshot using the "CTRL + V" shortcut again.
fields.summary: Attachment "The issue no longer exists." error

fields.description:
Problem
In Jira Service Desk reports is not possible to customize the results to use hh:mm:ss.

Suggestion
Make the reports customizable.
fields.summary: Jira Service Desk Reports using hh:mm:ss format

fields.description:
It would be good if the *jira.clone.prefix* could be configured differently to each issue type.

Currently, modifying the property impacts in every issue type.
fields.summary: Ability to edit the Clone prefix to each issue type separately

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It is not possible to use macros like %%CURRENT_USER%% and %%CURRENT_DATETIME%% when creating a post-function that updates a certain field, if that field's type is _Text_

h3. Suggested Solution
Create the possibility of using these macros in text fields together with additional text. Example: possibility to have a post function put the following in a text field:
_%%CURRENT_USER%% resolved this issue at %%CURRENT_DATETIME%%_
fields.summary: using macros in text field post function

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Clicking on the refresh button in Project Setting Development Tools does not generate error log if the connection fail

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure Apache Web Proxy in front of Bitbucket Server
# Create Application Link between Bitbucket Server and Jira Cloud through the proxy server
Clicking on the refresh button in Project Setting Development Tools works fine now
# Configure Apache Web Proxy to deny access to the path "/rest/capabilities"
Jira Cloud Application Link still show Green status connection to Bitbucket Server
# Click on the refresh button in Project Setting Development Tools
It show warning on the Capabilities
# Check Jira Cloud log

h3. Expected Results
It will have Error log that it fail to access the URL "/rest/capabilities"

h3. Actual Results
It only have the following warning message
{noformat}
checkConnect ip: xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx:443 ([outbound-proxy.xxxxx.net])
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
* It should show a better error message if it fail to access the URL "/rest/capabilities"
* Bitbucket Server access log does not have any request to "/rest/capabilities"
fields.summary: No error in log when refreshing Project Development Tools

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the rest API call for transition only returns the list transition that is available to the current user which is:
{code:java}
curl --user email@example.com:<api_token> \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --url 'https://your-domain.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/{issueIdOrKey}/transitions' {code}
h3. Suggested Solution

To have a REST API call to retrieve transition history that was marked in an issue
h3. Why this is important

For analytics purpose and to measure lifecycle of an issue
fields.summary: REST API call to display all transition that was marked

fields.description:
Hi,

i'm running a couple of Jira instances, some on my own, some for clients. Not everything is Jira's Cloud Variante, but i need to collect somehow my logged working hours (and the hours of my employees) accross all instances to do my billing. Would be a very nice feature.
fields.summary: Multi-User-Multi-Jira-Timereports

fields.description:
h3. Summary

We have been alerted of customers receiving emails from bounce@spemail-us.atlassian.net as email servers (most commonly Microsoft) are requiring headers to be set on emails. 
 We are working on solving the problem in a joint effort with our mail delivery service.

Note that this only affects Jira Cloud, not Jira Server. It also impacts Confluence Cloud.
h3. Steps to reproduce

None
h3. Expected Result

Customer should get emails from jira@sitename.atlassian.net address
h3. Actual Result

Customer get emails from jira@sitename.atlassian.net address
-Customers are getting emails from [bounce@spemail-us.atlassian.net|mailto:bounce@spemail-us.atlassian.net]-

-Mail from Jira and Confluence will appear as being sent from the following addresses according to product & region. If you have automation rules that are triggered based on these emails, you may need to update your rules:-
 * -*[jira@mail-us.atlassian.net|mailto:jira@mail-us.atlassian.net]* _on behalf of Sender_ <jira@your_instance>-
 * -*[jira@mail-eu.atlassian.net|mailto:jira@mail-eu.atlassian.net]* _on behalf of Sender_ <jira@your_instance>-
 * -*[confluence@mail-us.atlassian.net|mailto:confluence@mail-us.atlassian.net]* _on behalf of Sender_ <confluence@your_instance>-
 * -*[confluence@mail-eu.atlassian.net|mailto:confluence@mail-eu.atlassian.net]* _on behalf of Sender_ <confluence@your_instance>-

h3. Workaround

If the problem is affecting routing of your emails and this affects your business, please get in touch with support as we can apply a temporary solution until the situation is resolved.
fields.summary: Customer receiving emails from bounce@spemail-us.atlassian.net

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a field from *_Capture for Jira_* is set as required it does not appear on the create issue view and prevents the issue from being created.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud with add-on _*Capture for Jira*_ enabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install the add-on *_Capture for Jira_*
# Make the field from _*Capture for Jira*_ required (*test session* for instance)
# Add the field to the default field configuration and to the correct field screen 
# Try to create a new issue of the issue type that contains the required custom field 

h3. Expected Results
The field should be displayed on the create issue view as required

h3. Actual Results
The field does not appear on the create issue view and when the user hits the create button nothing happens. 
No error can be found on the logs of Jira but on the console of the browser a 400 error is displayed along with the following message: 
{code}{"errorMessages":[],"errors":{"customfield_ID":"Field_name is required."}}{code} 
!404.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
Not set any field from Capture for Jira as required
fields.summary: Required field from Capture for Jira do not appear on create issue and prevents the issue from being created

fields.description: It would be very helpful to have the ability to export Kanban Boards to an Excel/XLS file. This would help with reporting without needing to utilize a chart directly.
fields.summary: Export Kanban Boards to Excel/XLS

fields.description:
*Use case:* As a user entering complex documentation, I have _already written the text_ of the issue or story, and now I am _going back_ to add hyperlinks. I highlight text I wish to link off-site, click the Hyperlink button, and wysiwyg Hyperlink Widget helpfully adds the markup for a web link, but it highlights the text I've written.  10/10 times I have to curse-or to the right and shift-cursor-highlight the URL to be replaced with a simply cmd-V. 

*Requested:* When text is highlighted in the wysiwyg and Link button is clicked, the widget should highlight the destination URL instead of the text to be linked.  In this scenario, I will be able to cmd-V paste my URL and move on.
fields.summary: When adding a link with the wysiwyg widget button, highlight the URL not the linked text
